message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void addEmployee(Employee emp){
    if (employees.isEmpty()) {
        minSal = emp.getSalary();
        maxSal = emp.getSalary();
    } else {
        if (minSal > emp.getSalary()) {
            minSal = emp.getSalary();
        }
        if (maxSal < emp.getSalary()) {
            maxSal = emp.getSalary();
        }
    }
    employees.add(emp);
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can initialize minSal and maxSal with the salary of the first employee added to the department. Then, for each subsequent employee, you compare their salary with minSal and maxSal, and update these values accordingly. This way, you always keep track of the minimum and maximum salary in the department.
